column1: Gamling (late Third Age) was a man of Rohan
column5: entry "Gamling" and the leader of the watchers of Helms Dike.

column1: ==History==
An old man during the War of the Ring
column2: Gamling was still a commanding presence at the time of the Battle of the Hornburg. During the battle Gamling was the first to realize that Orcs had penetrated Helms Deep through its culvert
column3: and he led the counterattack himself.

column1: Gamling seems to have been brought up in the western valleys of Rohan; he understood the tongue of Dunland that was still spoken in those regions.
When the Deeping Wall was taken
column2: Gamling was one of those swept back into the narrows.  When the battle was over Gamling
column4: Gimli and others came forth from the caves.

column1: ==Etymology==
Gamling translates to "old man" from the Old English term
column6: but only found in Old English in verse-language

column1: Gamling is somewhat anglicized/modernized while genuinely it should be Gameling. It would be one of the words and names that hobbits recognized as similar to Hobbitish (like Shadowfax or Gríma).
